excerpt: Elegant Victorian pier lined with seaside novelties and food stalls, including a pier-end bar.
detail_description: Llandudno Pier is a stunning Victorian structure that stretches over 700m above sea level, making it one of the longest and most exquisite piers in Wales and the entire United Kingdom. This Grade II listed pier offers a delightful array of seaside attractions, shops, and food stalls, including a charming bar at its end. Visitors can indulge in delicious treats while enjoying captivating views of the Irish Sea.
name: Llandudno Pier
address: N Parade, Llandudno, LL30 2LP, United Kingdom

excerpt: Limestone headland with trail & cablecar access, offering picturesque vistas, a cafe & a playground.
detail_description: Great Orme is a stunning limestone headland in Llandudno, offering picturesque vistas of the sea and Wales, including the Isle of Man and Snowdonia National Park. It's a 350-million-year-old country park with miles of paths to explore, an ancient mine, and wild nature with Kashmir goats. Visitors can reach the top via cable car or tramway and enjoy the Old Mines. The area also features a ski and snowboard center for winter sports enthusiasts.
name: Great Orme
address: Llandudno, LL30 2XF, United Kingdom

excerpt: This cable-hauled street tramway, the last in Great Britain, offers a scenic ride to Summit Station.
detail_description: The Great Orme Tramway, the last of its kind in Great Britain, has been a top tourist attraction in Wales for over a century. This unique funicular tramway travels on public roads and offers a scenic ride from Victoria station to Summit Station at the summit of Great Orme.
name: Great Orme Tramway
address: Llandudno, UK

detail_description: West Shore Beach is a beautiful sandy beach located in a coastal town in north Wales. It is quieter compared to the North Shore Beach, making it an ideal spot for those seeking a more peaceful environment. The beach offers a large expanse of sand that stretches far out to sea during low tide, providing visitors with a gorgeous setting to enjoy.
name: West Shore Beach
address: Llandudno, LL30 2AG, United Kingdom

excerpt: World's largest prehistoric copper mine, with a visitor center, self-guided tunnel tours & a shop.
detail_description: Great Orme Mines, discovered in 1987, are the world's largest prehistoric copper mines dating back to the Bronze Age, around 4,000 years ago. The site offers a unique insight into ancient Britain and its advanced society long before Roman invasion. With over 5 miles of tunnels to explore using only primitive tools like stones and bones, visitors can gain a deeper understanding of this historical era. The mine features a visitor center and self-guided tunnel tours for an immersive experience.
name: Great Orme Mines
address: Llandudno, LL30 2XG, United Kingdom

excerpt: Modern venue staging theatre, film, touring musicals and comedy, with bright, seafront restaurant.
detail_description: Located in the picturesque town of Llandudno, Conwy Country Borough, Venue Cymru is a versatile modern venue that hosts a wide array of events. Originally known as the Aberconwy Centre & North Wales Theatre & Conference Centre, it serves as a conference center, arena, and theater. The facility boasts impressive seating capacities for various seating styles and hosts renowned entertainment acts including the Welsh National Opera, film premieres, stand-up comedy shows, and more.
name: Venue Cymru
address: The Promenade, Penrhyn Cres, Llandudno LL30 1BB, United Kingdom

detail_description: Nestled on the picturesque slopes of the Great Orme in Llandudno, Happy Valley Botanical Gardens is a delightful retreat that celebrates nature's beauty. Originally gifted to commemorate Queen Victoria's Golden Jubilee, this enchanting garden is a haven for wildlife and plant enthusiasts alike. Visitors can enjoy leisurely family walks along paved pathways that meander through lush greenery, exotic plants, and tranquil ponds.
name: Happy Valley Botanical Gardens
address: Happy Valley Rd, Llandudno, LL30 2QL, United Kingdom

excerpt: Llandudno is a coastal town in north Wales. It’s known for North Shore Beach and 19th-century Llandudno Pier, with shops and a games arcade. Northwest of town, the cliffs of Great Orme headland jut into the sea. Ancient tunnels lead to a cavern at Great Orme Mines. A 1902 tramway has an upper and lower section, and travels to the headland’s summit. To the east, smaller headland Little Orme is a nature reserve.
detail_description: Llandudno, a charming coastal town in north Wales, is famous for its North Shore Beach and the 19th-century Llandudno Pier. The Great Orme headland offers stunning cliffs and ancient tunnels leading to the Great Orme Mines. Visitors can take a tramway to reach the summit of the headland or explore the nature reserve at Little Orme to the east.
name: Llandudno
address: UK

excerpt: Long-standing mountain cablecar system known for its panoramic views, operating Apr–Oct.
detail_description: The Summit Cable Car Station, located at the top of the Great Orme in North Wales, offers a breathtaking panoramic view of Llandudno. Operating from April to October, this long-standing cable car system provides visitors with a scenic ride down to the town, covering a distance of over 1.6 kilometers and offering stunning views as it approaches the iconic Llandudno Pier.
name: Summit Cable Car Station
address: Llandudno, LL30 2XF, United Kingdom

detail_description: Llandudno Promenade is a picturesque stretch of Victorian-era architecture along the Irish Sea, offering stunning panoramic views. For those seeking adventure, the nearby Great Orme Country Park features an extensive network of trails through limestone cliffs, heathland, and ancient woodland. The promenade itself spans almost two miles from Llandudno Pier to Craigside, with charming hotels and traditional attractions like Punch and Judy shows during the summer months.
name: Llandudno Promenade
address: Gloddaeth Cres, Llandudno, LL30 1AN, United Kingdom

excerpt: Small museum featuring unique exhibits on the history of Llandudno, along with a gift shop.
detail_description: Amgueddfa Llandudno Museum is a small but charming museum that offers a glimpse into the rich history of Llandudno. From prehistoric times to its development as a seaside resort, the exhibits cover various periods and categories, including Roman and Medieval eras. The museum also features period rooms and a gift shop for visitors to explore. Additionally, nearby attractions such as the Home Front Experience and the Chocolate Experience provide further opportunities for exploration in the area.
name: Llandudno Museum
address: Museum and Gallery Chardon, 19 Gloddaeth St, Llandudno LL30 2DD, United Kingdom

detail_description: When in Llandudno, a must-visit attraction is the Llandudno Chocolate Experience. This unique adventure takes you on a journey through 5000 years of chocolate history, starting from a Mayan hut and progressing through nine different eras. The museum, located near the chocolate factory, consists of themed rooms that are filled with fascinating information about the evolution of chocolate.
name: Llandudno Chocolate Experience
address: John Street Cocoa Works, Llandudno, LL30 2AB, United Kingdom

excerpt: Exhibits showcasing life for civilians during World War II, including recreations of shops & homes.
detail_description: Step back in time and immerse yourself in the civilian life during World War II at the Home Front Museum in Llandudno. This living history museum offers a unique experience, showcasing recreated shops and homes from the 1940s. The museum, housed in a former garage used by the fire service during the war, is small but rich with history.
name: Home Front Museum
address: New St, Llandudno, LL30 2YF, United Kingdom

excerpt: Contemporary Welsh and international art, plus cafe, housed in a 1901 building and modern extension.
detail_description: Nestled in the charming seaside town of Llandudno, the Mostyn Gallery is a vibrant hub for contemporary Welsh and international art. Established in 1901 by Lady Augusta Mostyn, this gallery beautifully marries its historical roots with modern design elements, featuring an impressive Edwardian red brick facade alongside sleek contemporary spaces. Visitors can immerse themselves in inspiring exhibitions while enjoying a delightful cafe experience and browsing through a shop filled with exquisite artworks and handicrafts.
name: Mostyn
address: 12 Vaughan St, Llandudno, LL30 1AB, United Kingdom

excerpt: Year-round center offering an artificial ski & boarding slope, a toboggan run, tubing & mini golf.
detail_description: Llandudno Snowsports Centre is a year-round destination that offers an artificial ski and boarding slope, a toboggan run, tubing, and mini golf. The center provides various lessons for skiing and snowboarding to help visitors get accustomed to the slope or enhance their skills. Taster sessions are available for those interested in trying out skiing or snowboarding, offering an hour of familiarization with equipment and essential skills such as speeding up, slowing down, making turns, and stopping on the slope.
name: Llandudno Snowsports Centre
address: Alex Munro Wy, Happy Valley Rd, Llandudno LL30 2LR, United Kingdom

detail_description: North Shore Beach, located in Llandudno Bay, is a picturesque two-mile stretch of sandy coastline nestled between the impressive limestone headlands of the Great Orme and the Little Orme. This beach has been recognized with the Seaside Award for its exceptional cleanliness and management. It is a favorite destination for families, offering ample space for building sandcastles and engaging in various beach activities such as windsurfing and parasailing.
name: North Shore Beach
address: Llandudno, LL30 2LN, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Boathouse Climbing Centre is a facility that offers climbers access to various types of climbing surfaces, including walls, roofs, and ropes. The centre also has a bouldering area.
name: Boathouse Climbing Centre
address: The Old Lifeboat Station, Lloyd St, Llandudno LL30 2YG, United Kingdom

excerpt: Terraced gardens, a Victorian monument & waterfront views, plus wooded trails with famed carvings.
detail_description: Happy Valley Rd is a picturesque route offering terraced gardens, a Victorian monument, and stunning waterfront views. Visitors can explore wooded trails adorned with famous carvings. Convenient parking is available along the road for those arriving by car. Accessible from North Parade or Marine Drive, this scenic road provides easy travel to and from Llandudno and the peninsula.
name: Happy Valley Rd
address: Llandudno, UK

excerpt: Tranquil oceanside park featuring open grassy fields, wildlife & sweeping views, along with a cafe.
detail_description: Y Gogarth Great Orme Country Park is a serene coastal park with vast open fields, diverse wildlife, and stunning panoramic views. The Marine Drive offers a picturesque four-mile route around the base of the Great Orme headland, providing travelers with captivating scenery and ample parking opportunities. This massive limestone rock formation is not only an impressive natural landmark but also a protected area for rare habitats and species. Families can enjoy various kid-friendly activities while exploring the designated conservation areas.
name: Y Gogarth Great Orme Country Park
address: Llandudno, LL30 2BW, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Alice Statue in Llandudno is a fantastic attraction that pays homage to the town's Victorian tourism history and its connection to Lewis Carroll's novels. The statues are part of an "Alice Trail" that takes a few hours to complete, as they are scattered throughout the town. Visitors can enjoy the challenge of finding all the Alice in Wonderland characters while exploring Llandudno on foot.
name: Alice Statue
address: Augusta St, Llandudno, LL30 2AF, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Great Orme Summit Pay & Display Car Park is conveniently located near the main entrance, accessible via St Marys Road off Lloyd St. Visitors can park for free with a Penderyn Distillery ticket and explore the beautiful coastal resort of Llandudno. The thrilling drive up to the summit offers breathtaking views and access to the cable cars. It's advisable to plan your visit carefully as the last cable car departs at 3pm.
name: Great Orme Summit Pay & Display Car Park
address: The Summit Complex, Great Ormes Head, Llandudno LL30 2QR, United Kingdom

detail_description: Penderyn Llandudno Lloyd St Distillery is a new addition to the picturesque setting of Llandudno, North Wales. The distillery, which opened in May 2021, is housed in a Grade II listed Old Board School on Lloyd Street. It aims to revive the spirit of the original Welsh Whisky distillery at Frongoch that closed over 100 years ago.
name: Penderyn Llandudno Distillery - Visitor Centre and Shop
address: Old Board School, Lloyd St, Llandudno LL30 2YG, United Kingdom

excerpt: Conwy, previously known in English as Conway, is a walled market town, community and the administrative centre of Conwy County Borough in North Wales. The walled town and castle stand on the west bank of the River Conwy, facing Deganwy on the east bank. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Conwy, also known as Conway, is a charming walled market town and the administrative center of Conwy County Borough in North Wales. Situated on the west bank of the River Conwy, it faces Deganwy on the opposite bank. The town is famous for its well-preserved walls and castle that offer stunning views of the surrounding area. One popular spot in Conwy is Providero, which is renowned for its freshly roasted coffee, loose leaf tea, and local artisan hot chocolate.
name: Conwy
address: United Kingdom

excerpt: Charming, major thoroughfare offering diverse shops & restaurants, plus religious landmarks.
detail_description: Mostyn St is a delightful and bustling thoroughfare that boasts an array of shops, eateries, and religious landmarks. Visitors to Llandudno can now enjoy a fully digital augmented reality trail for mobile devices or opt for the traditional Walking Trail with a Souvenir Guide from the Tourist Information Centre on Mostyn Street. The trail features brass plaques on the pavement marking locations in the story, as well as moving story characters that can be captured with a mobile device.
name: Mostyn St
address: Llandudno, UK

excerpt: Quaint, elevated arcade featuring national & indie retailers, restaurants & a multi-story car park.
name: Victoria Shopping Centre
address: 48 Mostyn St, Llandudno, LL30 2RP, United Kingdom

detail_description: If you're looking for a unique way to experience the stunning scenery of Llandudno, consider embarking on one of the delightful Llandudno Boat Trips. These excursions offer an incredible opportunity to admire the majestic Great Orme and its smaller counterpart, Little Orme, from a fresh perspective on the water. With various operators providing options ranging from serene sightseeing cruises to exhilarating speedboat adventures, there's something for everyone in your travel crew.
name: Llandudno Boat Trips
address: North Shore Jetty, Promenade, Llandudno LL30 2LS, United Kingdom

detail_description: Embark on an unforgettable journey through Llandudno aboard the Great Orme Tramway, where history and stunning vistas intertwine. A stop at Halfway Station offers a delightful opportunity to delve into the intriguing past of this iconic tramway. Take a moment to soak in the scenery before continuing your ascent to the summit, where even more breathtaking views await.
name: Halfway Station
address: Llandudno, LL30 2XG, United Kingdom

detail_description: Alice Cottage is a charming accommodation option in Llandudno, perfect for those looking for a unique experience. The cottage is linked to the town's Alice in Wonderland trail, which appeals to both children and adults seeking something different from typical seaside activities. This connection dates back to the 1800s when the real-life Alice Pleasance Liddell spent her holidays in Llandudno.
name: Alice Cottage
address: 8C Brookes St, Llandudno, LL30 2TT, United Kingdom

excerpt: This charming 16th-century residence provides audio tours & is popular as a wedding venue.
detail_description: Plas Mawr, meaning "Great Hall," is a 16th-century residence located on Conwy High Street. Built between 1576 and 1585 by Robert Wynn, it is preserved by Cadw and offers self-guided audio tours. The house showcases original plasterwork in the bedrooms and Great Chamber, as well as Tudor technology in the kitchen. Visitors can explore the garden, courtyard, and climb to the tower for stunning views of Conwy.
name: Plas Mawr
address: High St, Conwy, LL32 8DE, United Kingdom

excerpt: Stone & half-timbered merchant's house dating from the 1300s, featuring historic furniture & art.
detail_description: Aberconwy House is a well-preserved 14th-century stone and half-timbered merchant's house, showcasing historic furniture and art. The tiny medieval dwelling spans four rooms over two floors, each representing different eras of its use. Despite its small size, the National Trust has maintained the house for visitors to explore. The ground floor houses a National Trust shop while the furnished upper rooms depict daily life from various periods in history.
name: National Trust - Aberconwy House
address: Castle St, Conwy, LL32 8AY, United Kingdom

detail_description: Bonkerz Fun Centre in Llandudno is a fantastic option for families, especially on days when the weather isn't ideal. The play center offers a variety of activities including slides and exploration areas to keep kids entertained and active. Visitors praise the excellent play frame suitable for all ages and abilities, as well as the great facilities such as a cafe serving snacks and drinks.
name: Bonkerz Fun Centre
address: Llewelyn Ave, Llandudno, LL30 2ER, United Kingdom

detail_description: St. John's Methodist Church is conveniently situated near Llandudno's famous promenade and town center, making it easily accessible for visitors staying at nearby hotels. The church is known for its welcoming atmosphere, vibrant community, and engaging sermons. It played a significant role in the town's expansion during the Victorian era. Families can enjoy the Wednesday morning playgroup sessions with activities for children and refreshments for adults.
name: St John's Methodist Church
address: 53-55 Mostyn St, Llandudno, LL30 2NN, United Kingdom

detail_description: Llandudno Tourist Information Centre is a hub of friendly and helpful staff who provide valuable local insights and recommendations. Visitors can purchase maps for trails like the Alice in Wonderland Trail, as well as locally made souvenirs. The center also offers information on various activities such as taking the San Franciscan-style tramway or alpine cable car to the summit of the Great Orme Country Park, exploring prehistoric copper mines, and enjoying a pleasant promenade and beach walk.
name: Llandudno Tourist Information Centre
address: 26, Victoria Centre, Mostyn St, Llandudno LL30 2RP, United Kingdom

name: Porth Dyniewaid
address: 116 Penrhyn Beach E, Penrhyn Bay, Llandudno LL30 3RW, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Owls Trust in Llandudno is a delightful zoo focused on the preservation of owls and other wildlife, making it an ideal destination for families and nature enthusiasts. Despite being free to enter, this hidden gem offers a larger-than-expected space with well-cared-for birds. Visitors can enjoy interacting with knowledgeable and friendly staff who provide insights into the diverse bird species and their individual personalities.
name: The Owls Trust
address: Bodafon Farm Park, Bodafon Rd, Llandudno LL30 3BB, United Kingdom

name: The Floral Clock
address: S Parade, Llandudno, LL30 2LN, United Kingdom

detail_description: Haulfre Gardens is a picturesque location situated on the side of the Orme, offering stunning views of Llandudno and its surroundings. The gardens feature a variety of beautiful plants and flowers, creating a lovely atmosphere for visitors to enjoy. While some feel that the gardens may not be as well-maintained as they once were, many still appreciate the natural beauty and tranquility it offers.
name: Haulfre Gardens
address: Cwlach Rd, Llandudno, LL30 2HT, United Kingdom

detail_description: Nestled in the charming seaside town of Llandudno, The Mad Hatter sculpture invites visitors into a delightful fusion of art and the enchanting world crafted by Lewis Carroll. During my recent visit, I enjoyed a sun-soaked afternoon on the beach, where parking was conveniently affordable for a few hours of exploration. The beachfront is brimming with activities and sights to discover, making it an ideal spot for families and wanderers alike.
name: The Mad Hatter
address: Gloddaeth Cres, Llandudno, LL30 1AN, United Kingdom

detail_description: The White Rabbit Statue in Llandudno, a sculpture celebrating the town's connection to Lewis Carroll and his famous Alice in Wonderland characters, is a must-see. It can be quite challenging to locate some of the other characters besides the obvious one near the station. However, now protected by glass screens and conveniently located next to the Tram Shelter maintained by the Friends of West Shore, this statue is definitely worth admiring while waiting for a bus.
name: The White Rabbit Statue
address: Gloddaeth Ave, Llandudno, LL30 2AW, United Kingdom

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque coastal town of Llandudno, the enchanting Queen of Hearts sculpture stands as a delightful homage to Lewis Carroll's beloved "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland." This whimsical piece captures the imagination and adds a touch of magic to its surroundings. Visitors can enjoy this charming artwork while taking in the breathtaking views of the coastline. The statue is conveniently located near a beautiful church, creating an intriguing blend of art and architecture that enhances your exploration experience.
name: The Queen of Hearts
address: Gloddaeth St, Llandudno, LL30 2DG, United Kingdom

excerpt: Originally opened in the 1930s, this modest community park features play equipment & grassy areas.
detail_description: This park is located in a nice part of Craigedon, with plenty of open space for children to play. It features swings, a roundabout and a slide.
name: Queen's Park
address: Queen's Rd, Llandudno, LL30 1TY, United Kingdom

excerpt: Townhouse with changing exhibits by artists working in Wales, plus 20th-century contemporary art.
detail_description: Ffin y Parc Gallery is a charming country house and art gallery located on the outskirts of Llanrwst, Wales. The gallery offers elegant rooms and fully equipped cottages for visitors. It has recently relocated to Llandudno on the North Wales coast in March 2024. Visitors can enjoy the beautifully decorated studio with unique artworks and pottery, as well as explore the picturesque gardens while savoring a delightful cup of coffee and cinnamon roll at the cafe.
name: Ffin y Parc Gallery
address: Trinity Square, Llandudno, LL30 2RH, United Kingdom

excerpt: Tiny park with a statue of the March Hare from Alice in Wonderland & Victorian-era public toilets.
detail_description: North Western Gardens is a charming park located in downtown Llandudno, featuring a statue of the March Hare from Alice in Wonderland and Victorian-era public toilets. It's an ideal stop for visitors staying at hotels in the area, with nearby attractions including Holy Trinity Church and St. John's Methodist Church. Families can enjoy a fun vacation by visiting other recommended spots like St. David's Church, Bodafon Farm Park, and Great Orme Country Park.
name: North Western Gardens
address: Mostyn St, Llandudno, LL30 2NF, United Kingdom

detail_description: Pen-y-Dinas Hillfort is an iron age settlement with stunning views, including a picturesque town view. It's also home to Maen Sigl, known as Tudno's Cradle, where visitors can try rocking the stone to determine guilt. The site offers a peaceful retreat and can be easily accessed by car with just a short uphill walk from the car park. Visitors praise the breathtaking morning views and serene atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and enjoying nature.
name: Site of Pen-y-Dinas Hillfort
address: Wyddfyd Rd, Llandudno, LL30 2QL, United Kingdom

detail_description: The sculpture of the Cheshire Cat at the beach offers ample entertainment for children, with an expansive play area nearby and plenty of room to roam. They can even participate in a thrilling hunt for this iconic character from Alice in Wonderland. In addition, convenient restroom facilities are available, while various food vendors along the waterfront offer a variety of options for meals, snacks, and desserts. The Cheshire Cat sculpture is well-maintained and is one of the notable figures on the Alice in Wonderland Trail.
name: Cheshire Cat Statue
address: Llandudno, LL30 2BD, United Kingdom

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque town of Llandudno, the Gorsedd Stone Circle is a tranquil historical site that invites visitors to immerse themselves in its ancient heritage while enjoying stunning views of the surrounding Welsh countryside. This serene landmark offers a perfect escape for families, featuring nearby Alice in Wonderland statues that delight children and provide a safe environment away from traffic. On sunny days, it transforms into an idyllic picnic spot where you can savor fresh air amidst vibrant wildflowers.
name: Gorsedd Stone Circle
address: Llandudno, LL30 2ND, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Llandudno Victorian Extravaganza is a delightful celebration of the town's rich history and stunning Victorian architecture, taking place every May Day Bank Holiday weekend for over three decades. This vibrant event draws in thousands of visitors eager to experience its charm. Attendees can enjoy a grand parade, vintage car displays, and impressive steam engines that transport you back in time.
name: Llandudno Victorian Extravaganza
address: 8 Vaughan St, Llandudno, LL30 1AB, United Kingdom

detail_description: Tweedledee and Tweedledum is a charming garden with serene pathways, beautiful views, and an impressive variety of plants. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls through the well-maintained grounds, taking in the tranquil atmosphere and lush greenery. It's a delightful place for nature enthusiasts to explore and appreciate the natural beauty on display.
name: Tweedledee & Tweedledum
address: 15 W End Hill, Llandudno, LL30 2HN, United Kingdom

name: St. Tudno's Church
address: 2HL, St Tudno's Rd, Llandudno, United Kingdom

name: Penrhyn Bay Beach
address: Penrhyn Bay, Llandudno, LL30 3PH, United Kingdom
